textList.name: START_BEACON_ENGI
textList.text: You have arrived in Engi space. The Mantis have been threatening the Engi core worlds, but you should be able to stock up for your journey.
You have arrived in Engi space. The fall of the Federation has brought tough times for these robotic lifeforms, but they're usually willing to help.
You have arrived in Engi space. These masters of engineering will happily help the Federation, however in the current situation, their trust must first be earned.
In this sector, there are many ships with advanced drone technologies. Perhaps they can help you break away from the pursuing Rebel Fleet.
You arrive in the once quite peaceful Engi sector. These mechanized organisms can easily patch up your ship's hull. For a suitable fee, of course.
"01010111 01100101 01101100 01100011 01101111 01101101 01100101 00100001" — These numbers inscripted on the entry beacon seem to be a greeting message in binary! Oh those Engi...
The Engi have always been faithful allies of the Federation. They are ready to help even now, when the chance of Federation victory is extremely slim...

You have arrived in a sector belonging to the Engi. This race is famous for its adept engineering skills, so if you still haven't thought about replenishing supplies or patching up your ship — now is the right time.

textList.name: STORE_ENGI
textList.text: The Engi can do remarkable things with just a pile of scrap. The Engi hive at this beacon are selling equipment for just that.
A message arrives: "Your scrap, ours. Our weapons for you." You're about to raise the shields when you realize it's just an Engi trader looking for a trade.
An Engi ship hails: "Engine upgrade necessary for travel home. Sale of equipment necessary for engine upgrade."

textList.name: NOTHING_ENGI
textList.text: The complex arrangements of ship hulls and FTL drive capacitors floating abandoned in space suggest the Engi were here not too long ago; but no longer.
You arrive at a green planet with great plains and rolling waterfalls. It would be of little interest to the Engi nearby.

You have arrived near an Engi construction yard. Most Engi maintain their bi-pedal appearance out of habit but here you see a number of Engi hives working together to create massive organic machines adept at building ships. Truly a sight to behold.

Even though each "individual" Engi is made up of trillions of nano-machines, their culture still revolves around traditional social interactions. A nearby station seems to be constructed for entertainment of passing Engi travellers.

You see a number of Engi space stations and fleets nearby. Despite looking like piles of junk loosely tied together they are actually a model of efficiency. They just lack a certain aesthetic emphasis in their constructions.
This system appears quite peaceful. You're not sure how long it'll last between the combined threats of the Rebels and Mantis.
There are a number of merchant ships passing through the area despite the threat of Mantis invasion. No doubt interested in buying the efficient technology of the Engi.
You see a small Rebel carrier in the distance. You lay low and try to blend in with the other traffic. However it's surprising to see a Rebel military ship alone deep in Engi space.
The Engi seem to have avoided this particular node, along with every other life-form. You keep your eyes peeled for reasons why, but spin up the FTL without event.
A cluster of Engi satellites in orbit of a nearby planet are the only clue the mechanical species was ever here. You have other places to be.

textList.name: ENGI_GIFT
textList.text: An Engi vessel hails you. "Identity: Federation? Outlier probability. Implies... revival. Implies... hope. Assistance suggested." They offer some supplies.
You cross paths with an Engi cargo vessel hurrying home before the Mantis fleets attempt to take over this sector. They're happy to offload some of their cargo to get home faster.
You make contact with an isolated Engi science station who are staying put despite the likelihood of Mantis invasion. They suggest you trial some experimental technology.
This was the site of a recent battle. Either a show of Mantis force, or the Engi here weren't disposed to go peacefully. You pick through the pieces.

event.name: ENGI_FLEET_DELAY
event.text: You notice an Engi colony hiding on the other side of a nearby moon. It turns out they're excavating an equipment cache from the Federation-Mantis War, and they suggest it might be used to lure the pursuing rebel fleet.

choice.text: Booby trap the cache.

event.text: You transfer down some missile warheads and the Engi rig them to blow before setting a distress signal to attract the fleet's attention.

choice.text: Secure the cache.

event.text: You have the Engi complete their excavations and bring the supplies on-board.

event.name: ENGI_SURRENDER
event.text: An Engi cruiser in the vicinity watches your arrival. Seeing you jump in armed to the teeth, their captain immediately broadcasts its surrender: "Subject goal: wealth. Engi motivation: survival. Transfer of goods acceptable?"

choice.text: Explain that you're friendly.
Accept their offer of surrender.

event.text: The Engi obediently transfer over the goods and get on their way. Money for nothing.
The Engi seem relieved, and eager to get underway. They set off without saying goodbye.
The Engi seem relieved, and eager to get underway. They set off without saying goodbye.

The Engi are satisfied with your explanation. "Beneficial. Subject goal: long, long journey. Remains compatible with transfer of goods from Engi." They send over the gear willingly, and you feel better for it.
Learning that you are fighting on the side of the Federation, the Engi help you improve your ship's reactor, as well as install an additional augmentation.
Learning that you are fighting on the side of the Federation, the Engi help you improve your ship's reactor, as well as install an additional augmentation.
The Engi calm down and Send your hull repair drone to your ship, which patches up your ship.

textList.name: ENGI_MANTIS_FIGHT
textList.text: A mixed radar signal turns out to be a Mantis attack ship scavenging the remains of an Engi carrier. They turn and fight.
You come across a Mantis raider taking pot shots at a defenceless Engi supply station. Discovering its weapons aren't much of a match for the station's armour, it turns on your ship. Battle stations!
The area looks clear, and you prepare to jump off, but a Mantis scout jumps in behind you! They're as surprised as you are, but their weapons are already online.
You find a Mantis ship harrying a small squad of Engi. They make it to the node and jump off, leaving you toe to toe with their pursuer!

event.name: ENGI_REBEL_FIGHT
event.text: The rebel fighter here would seem to suggest elements of the rebel fleet are already making incursions on Engi space. You move to engage.

event.name: ENGI_PIRATE_FIGHT
event.text: There must have been rich pickings for pirates around here up until war broke out. The pirate you encounter here looks worn down, but hungry. You'll have to fight!

event.name: ENGI_STATION_DISTRESS
event.text: You receive a distress call from a nearby Engi ship: "Assistance requested. Danger present. Imminent destruction."

choice.text: Respond to the call and move in to assist.
Keep your distance.

event.text: You receive another message from the ship, this time with a Mantis at the comm-log. "Foolish meatsacks," he yells. Sensors indicate the ship is moving in to attack and boarders teleport from the station.
You approach to find a Mantis ship assaulting a small Engi space station. You prepare for a fight!
The Engi station is stripped bare and there are signs of a fierce battle. The Mantis must have left the distress call active to lure other ships into a trap.
The station was in the process of being evacuated. A number of civilian Engi express their gratitude as they finalize their preparations to leave. They offer some fuel as a reward.
The station hails you, "Gratitude. Expected probability of defeat without assistance... 86.2 percent. Request suitable reward."

choice.text: Request fuel.
Request a weapon.
Request a drone.
(Engi Crewmember) Threat unresolved. Current mission imperative: Protocol 52.34.

event.text: They respond, "Understood. Re-establishment of Federation — paramount. Transmitting hidden base coordinates. Repairing hull and installing anti-ship ordnance."
They thank you for the assistance and when you tell them of your mission, one of the Engi asks if they can assist your crew. You welcome them aboard.
"Request granted. Fuel transferring."
"Request granted. Fuel transferring."
"Request denied. Change request."

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REBEL
event.text: The distress signal originates from a small Engi ship under attack by a rebel fighter - but when the Rebels see Federation markings they turn to attack!

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REBEL_RESULT
event.text: The Engi vessel turns out to be very poorly equipped - barely a runabout, really. They're trying to outrun the Rebels, and need all the help they can get.

choice.text: Give them 20 scrap.
Give them 35 scrap, 2 missiles and 2 fuel.
Give them nothing.

event.text: Engi can't feel fear, so they bear you no ill will when you explain you're unwilling to help. They set off on their journey and you do the same.
The words they use are "Need = fulfilled", but you take it for gratitude. They take the next jump in their long journey home.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have any supplies or weapons to spare, but they do send over a self-teleporting med-bot disperser they hope they won't need.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have any supplies or weapons to spare, but they do send over a self-teleporting repair-bot disperser they hope they won't need.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have much by way of supplies but they do offer a drone schematic for your use.
The Engi are grateful. They don't have much by way of supplies but they do offer a drone schematic for your use.

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REBEL_LIST2
event.text: They wouldn't get more than a few jumps with that load-out. You provide them with all the munitions and supplies they should need for the journey home. "Generosity magnitude unpredicted. Well-being syntax error [value too high]. Accept this token."

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR
event.text: You arrive at a smoldering Engi research station, its distress call unanswered - attacked by pirates or Mantis most likely. There may be someone left alive, or else something of value left on board.

choice.text: Board the station.
Ignore it.

event.text: The place looks in bad state, probably nothing of use there. Time to move on.

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Run another scan..
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Run another scan..

event.text: You Send your away team to investigate, but there's nothing save for the acidic stench of burnt Engi parts. This place is dead.
Your away team reports a wounded Engi and a functioning drone schematic. Then someone yells. The station reactor is overloading and they're running out of time!

choice.text: Save the Engi!
Save the drone schematic.
Save yourselves!

event.text: It's a tough order, but your crew's lives are the priority. They drop everything and return to the ship unharmed. You put some distance on the station before it blows.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Under the pheromones your crew can manage to save everything.

event.text: Pumped with pheromones, your crew acts quickly and accurately. As soon as you carry everything aboard and fly off, the station's reactor explodes. The rescued Engi thanks you and is ready to carry out your orders.

One of your crew valiantly grabs the Engi and throws it into the airlock right before the reactor blows and the automatic blast doors slam shut. You have no choice but to mourn their sacrifice and move on.

removeCrew.text: The brave crewmember's clone strides from the Clone Bay, rather full of themself after such a heroic act.

event.text: The Engi who was saved offers to join your crew.
As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
The Engi who was saved offers to join your crew.
Your crew return safely to the airlock with the injured Engi and you put some distance on the station before it blows. The Engi, impressed by your crew, volunteers to join you.
Your away team heads home with the goods, but as they transfer back to the ship a small explosion blows the airlock and one of the crew is sucked out into space!

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

The Engi don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your crew return safely to the airlock with the drone control and you put some distance on the station before it blows.

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR_SCAN
event.text: Scans reveal the station's reactor is overloading! Not only that, but an injured Engi and a functioning drone schematic are still on board! There's not time for both...

choice.text: Save the Engi!

event.text: Your away team heads straight for the Engi and returns with time to spare. You put some distance on the station before it blows and the Engi is so impressed by your crew that they volunteer to join you!

choice.text: Save the drone schematic!

event.text: The Engi don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your away team heads straight for the goods and returns with time to spare. You put some distance on the station before it blows.

event.text: Pumped with pheromones, your crew acts quickly and accurately. As soon as you carry everything aboard and fly off, the station's reactor explodes. The rescued Engi thanks you and is ready to carry out your orders.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_1
event.text: You arrive near a small fleet of civilian Engi ships. A simple decryption and translation of their comm frequency tells you that they are having a frantic discussion about something obviously troubling them.

choice.text: Message them and ask if you can help.

event.text: Slightly shocked at your question, their leader quickly responds, "Declined offer with apologetic gratitude. Topic of discussion private matter, no concern of Federation."

choice.text: Ignore it and move on.

event.text: You can't help but wonder what they were discussing as you prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Engi Crewmember) Have your Engi crewmember contact them.

event.text: Your crewmember syncs with the comm unit to communicate with them directly. You offer your help and a summary of the ship's mission. They respond, "Our goals have analogous elements. However, not all available for disclosure, discretion necessary."

choice.text: Offer your help.

event.text: "Secret technologies stolen by Mantis. Implicit connection to Rebels. Implicit. Tracked Mantis to hidden Rebel base, uploading coordinates."

"However, tracked second ship to different base. Would calculate probability but data insufficient. Cannot risk obvious Rebel-Engi conflict. Also, need time to acquire military ships. Assist in finding technology?"

choice.text: Agree.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2FAKE
event.text: You arrive at one of the Rebel bases that the Engi told you about. It appears abandoned except for one scout ship. Perhaps you could extract information from them.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2FAKE_SURRENDER
event.text: "Stop! I don't want to die here."

choice.text: Demand information on the stolen technology.

event.text: "Ah, so that's what you're after. Too bad, you followed the wrong ship. The envoy that passed through here was a fake, to trick fools like you. Now let us go!"

choice.text: Let them go.
Ignore him and attack.

event.text: "No, wait..." You cut the transmission and continue the assault.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2REAL
event.text: You arrive at one of the Rebel bases that the Engi told you about. It appears abandoned except for one scout ship. Perhaps you could extract information from them.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2REAL_SURRENDER
event.text: "Stop! This isn't worth dying for..."

choice.text: Demand information on the stolen technology.

event.text: "Of course, that's why you're here. Yes, they passed by here but I had nothing to do with it, I don't know what they were carrying. I'll transmit coordinates. Now just let us go..."

choice.text: Let them go.

event.text: You prepare an FTL message containing the coordinates to send to the Engi and get ready to jump.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_3
event.text: You have finally caught up with the ships you've been hunting. A hangar-sized cargo ship is being escorted by a number of Mantis ships. As you reconsider the assault, a squadron of Engi ships with pirate emblems jump in and assist you. You prepare to fight the Mantis but scans indicate they are manned by Rebels!

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_4
event.text: The Engi emerge victorious from their battles with only minor losses. They message you, "Project X-ME56 commissioned by Federation military research division. Advanced stealth cruiser. Project finished during rebellion. Unable to reconnect with Federation military command."

choice.text: Ask about the Mantis ships.

event.text: "Likely ploy by Rebels to avoid breaking non-aggression pact with Engi. 97.56 percent likely. Your mission to assist last Federation fleet, correct? Coordinates?"

choice.text: Transmit coordinates of Federation command.

event.text: "Satisfactory. Delivery of tech will assist in Federation cause. Gratitude alone insufficient. Commencing ship repair and compensation." Their crews deliver an advanced augmentation for installation but you're more pleased to hear that the Federation will have an improved arsenal.
event.unlockShip: The Engi secret tech has been delivered to the hangar. The stealth ship has been unlocked!

event.name: ENGI_SEX
event.text: What appeared to be a single damaged ship is in fact two ships that have smashed into each other... there is a flurry of comm signals and damage, and it's hard to determine what occurred. The vessels appear to be... Engi? They look locked together by the impact and can't free themselves.

choice.text: Attempt to help the ships by prying them apart.
Ignore the damaged vessels.
(Engi Crewmember) Have your Engi crewmember hail the vessel and assess the damage.

event.text: Your Engi crewmember refuses. In a halting use of adjectives and nouns, followed by some animated holographic aids, the Engi explains the ships are... using each other to, loosely translated, "achieve a union." For some reason, this consolidation of ship matter sounds embarrassing and personal.

You elect to leave the two Engi ships... to their "business." After questioning your Engi crewmember, however, you do manage to salvage what scrap parts you can from the perimeter, even though you feel slightly dirty for doing so.

choice.text: (Missile Weapon) Try to separate the ships with a missile salvo.

event.text: You fire a volley on the paired ships, but their defense drone takes down your warhead! Looks like they don't appreciate such "help" and go to attack you directly in a paired form.
To your surprise, one of the Engi vessels attacks! One ship detaches itself, surprisingly still quite whole, and opens fire - it looks like it's somehow identified you as hostile!
Looks like your intentions have been misinterpreted — the dual ship, somehow still able to manuever in this state, is attacking you!

destroyed.text: With the ship destroyed, the remaining Engi ship hails you frantically and explains the situation to you.

deadCrew.text: With the ship disabled, the remaining Engi ship hails you frantically and explains the situation to you.

destroyed.text: After the battle, heaps of debris fly all around your ship. You collecting everything that may come in handy.

deadCrew.text: The Engi crew is dead, and you collect a bunch of scrap. Their drone system remains intact, and it looks like you can actually remove it and install it on your ship!

choice.text: Take their drone system.

event.text: You install their drone system on your ship.

choice.text: Don't waste any time and prepare to jump.
(Drone Control) We already have a drone system; dismantle it for scrap.

event.text: You dismantle their drone system for scrap.

event.name: ENGI_SEX_SHIP_DONE
event.text: Apparently, you interrupted the equivalent of a "consolidation" of two ships that were using each other's parts to construct a new vessel. The Engi were not truly hostile, their targeting computers had not finished adjusting. There's nothing to be done about it now. You leave the remains for the surviving ship.

event.name: ENGI_VIRUS
event.text: The Engi are awaiting you at the beacon, with their weapons on-line! They explain a computer virus that is wanted for hostile acts against the Engi (multiple counts of binary scrambling, nano-dissolution, and variable interference) is aboard your vessel.
They insist they must destroy your ship to prevent the virus from escaping!

choice.text: Hold on! Let us try to purge the system code!
Attack the Engi vessel!

event.text: The Engi be damned, no one threatens your ship. You prepare for a fight!

choice.text: (Hacking) Isolate and quarantine the virus.

event.text: It takes some time, and the virus is slippery, but you eventually confine it to a useless sub-system prison where it frantically begins calculating insults at you. You eject the system from the ship and then silence the little binary criminal with your weapons.
The Engi thank you for deleting the virus, and jump away. They offer a unique ship augmentation as a reward.

choice.text: (Improved Hacking) Reprogram the virus.

event.text: You proceed to interface with the virus and optimize its repair and benevolence routines.
After a few minutes, the virus "sees the light" and integrates itself in a positive manner with the computer society on your ship, repairing your hull and attempting to optimize your reactor.
The Engi thank you for deleting the virus, and jump away. They offer a unique ship augmentation as a reward.

choice.text: (Advanced Hacking) Reprogram the virus.

event.text: You proceed to interface with the virus and optimize its repair and benevolence routines.
After a few minutes, the virus "sees the light" and integrates itself in a positive manner with the computer society on your ship, repairing your hull and attempting to optimize your reactor.
The Engi thank you for deleting the virus, and jump away. They offer a unique ship augmentation as a reward.

choice.text: (Lanius Crewmember) Your Lanius crewmember gestures frantically.

event.text: Oddly enough, the Lanius seems aware of which computer the virus is present in, and proceeds to... digest the terminal. There is a burst of O2, and the Engi ship powers down its weapons, no longer sensing the virus on board. The Engi send some parts over to repair your damaged computer, along with a unique ship augmentation as a reward for terminating the virus.

choice.text: (Engi Crewmember) Have your Engi crewmember negotiate with the Engi ship.

event.text: As the Engi attempts to contact the vessel and negotiate, your Engi crewmember suddenly dissolves into a cloud of nanites — the virus has murdered again! Detecting activity on board your ship, the Engi vessel opens fire!

removeCrew.text: The virus appears to have disrupted your clone bay's capability to revive the lost crewmember!

event.text: Wiping your engine core and shields proves useless... eventually you trap the virus in the weapons systems to purge it, but before you do, the Engi grow restless and attack!

Wiping the engine core and shields allows you to locate the threat in time. With the risk of infection prevented, the Engi thank you for removing the virus and prepare to jump. As a reward, they offer a unique augmentation along with some supplies.

destroyed.text: With the ship destroyed, you detect that the virus has abandoned your ship and disappeared somewhere within the systems of the wreckage. It will likely infect whatever Engi ship passes next, but your mission is too vital to risk re-infection by stopping it.

deadCrew.text: With the Engi crew dead, you detect that the virus has abandoned your ship and disappeared somewhere within the systems of Engi vessel. It will likely infect whatever Engi ship passes next, but your mission is too vital to risk re-infection by stopping it.

destroyed.text: With the ship destroyed, you scrap it and prepare to jump away.

deadCrew.text: With all the Engi dead, you take what you can and prepare to jump away.

event.name: ENGI_VIRUS_REBORN
event.text: To your surprise your Engi crewmember reforms. It looks as if the virus reconstituted, repurposed, and reprogrammed the Engi host and wants to travel with you... and it seems to have learned a great deal from its time on your ship.

event.name: REPAIR_ENGI
event.text: Before you is an Engi repair station. For a nominal fee they are willing to provide you with the necessary repairs and supplies.

choice.text: Check their prices.
(Engi Crewmember) Let your Engi crew-member ask for a free supply package.

event.text: Your Engi crew-member explains the importance of your mission to them, so they agree to help you for free.

choice.text: (Broken Flak Mark III) Ask if they can fix your weapon.
(Damaged Prototype) Ask if they can fix your prototype.
Decline their services.

event.name: REPAIR_ENGI_COST
event.text: You familiarize yourself with their prices...

choice.text: Select this option for supplies. [20 $]

event.text: The Engi accept your payment and send you supplies. Meanwhile, a repair crew patches up your ship.

choice.text: Select this option for supplies. [15 $]

event.text: The Engi accept your payment and send you supplies. Meanwhile, a repair crew patches up your ship.

choice.text: Select this option for supplies. [10 $]

event.text: The Engi accept your payment and send you supplies. Meanwhile, a repair crew patches up your ship.

choice.text: Decline their services.

event.text: The Engi carefully inspect the damage to the weapon. Apparently, the damage can be assessed and addressed correctly with the right equipment. Unfortunately, this repair station doesn't have such equipment. The Engi speak of another station not far from here, where you can get help, but it's hidden behind an asteroid belt, and without an improved FTL navigation system you won't be able to get through to it.

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Ask them to record the coordinates of the station into your Advanced FTL Navigation system.

event.text: They transmit the coordinates of the station. You still have time to use the other repair services the Engi have to offer at this station.

choice.text: Check their prices.
(Engi Crewmember) Let your Engi crew-member ask for a free supply package.

event.text: Your Engi crew-member explains the importance of your mission to them, so they agree to help you for free.

choice.text: Decline their services.
Ask them if there any are other possibilities to fix this weapon.

event.text: The Engi recommend you refer to their compatriots in their home sector, and you thank them for the information. You still have time to use the other repair services the Engi have to offer at this station.

choice.text: Check their prices.
(Engi Crewmember) Let your Engi crew-member ask for a free supply package.

event.text: Your Engi crew-member explains the importance of your mission to them, so they agree to help you for free.

choice.text: Decline their services.

event.name: REPAIR_ENGI_FIX_FLAK
event.text: The Engi are carefully inspecting the damage to the weapon. If anyone can fix it, it's the Engi.
With their secret technologies they fully repair the weapon and return it back to you, free of charge. You thank them before setting back out on your journey.

event.text: Before you is an Engi repair station. For a nominal fee they are willing to provide you with the necessary repairs and supplies.

choice.text: Check their prices.
(Engi Crewmember) Let your Engi crew-member ask for a free supply package.

choice.text: (Broken Flak Mark III) Ask if they can fix your weapon.
(Damaged Prototype) Ask if they can fix your prototype.
Decline their services.

textList.name: REPAIR_ENGI_PROTOTYPES_REPAIR_IN_PROGRESS
textList.text: The Engi take the scrap and the prototype for "troubleshooting". You're waiting for them to fix it...

textList.name: REPAIR_ENGI_PROTOTYPES_REPAIR_FINISHED
textList.text: ...finally, the Engi fix all the problems with the prototype, returning it back to you in mint condition.

textList.name: START_BEACON_MORPH
textList.text: After an ion pulsar shut down their AI self-restraint protocols, the group of Engi controlling this sector have come to the conclusion that other races' ships can be useful to them.

The Morphs have deactivated modules that define the optimal ship architecture to be the Engi design. They can thereby repair their damaged ships with the wreckage of other ships — without scrapping them completely.
Despite their general aggressiveness towards other races, Morphs are engaged in the protection of life on the planets within their sector.
Morphs often use the most diverse weapons and augmentations they find. This unpredictability often plays into their hands.

The Morph sectors are often replete with ion pulsars, which became the reason for their appearance as a separate sub-race of Engi. It is curious that ordinary Engi somehow find a common language with their relatives.

Almost immediately after their appearance, the Morphs began to massively transport huge blocks of ice-asteroids from somewhere to create favorable conditions on the planets. Now for some reason this process has stopped...
Due to local ionic storms, the Morphs partially lost their ability to communicate — their speech is full of mistakes and they only understand simple answers.

textList.name: STORE_MORPH
textList.text: A small trading station floods your communicators with indecipherable binary code. After making sure there is no threat, you slowly approach and dock.
The Morphs have set up a small shop at this beacon. You decide to check their stock.
You get a docking invitation from a small Morph trading station. You approach and examine their merchandise with interest.
On a huge ship, an Engi flaunts a hull plate of a Rock ship. These are Morph merchants, and they invite you to make a deal.

textList.name: NOTHING_MORPH
textList.text: This beacon is assembled from a pulse transducer and a piece of shock-absorbing polymer. An unremarkable design, but it's the only other thing here.
In the low bands of the comms channels, there's streams of undecipherable binary data. Not even Morphs could understand it!
Near your ship you see a small blue cloud. A surface analysis indicates that these are small crystals of pure ice.
There are signs of life on the nearby planet. One of the local species seems to be actively developing agriculture.
A surface analysis of the nearby planet indicates that it was subjected to active terraforming a few dozen cycles ago.
Analysis of the nearby planet's atmosphere reveals that it's suitable breathing for some forms of life. You're not one of them though.

textList.name: MENGI_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: A Morph ship awaits you near the beacon. Their guns pointed at you clearly hint that they mean to fight you.
Some Morphs are friendly to aliens. These ones definitely are not.
As soon as you appear at the beacon, a volley from Morph weapons flies at you. Luckily, you dodged it.
All hopes of flying safely along this route crumble away after a salvo from Morph weapons in your direction. It's hard to know what these Morphs are thinking...

The Morphs at this beacon send you a meaningless set of binary data. You send back a random set of ones and zeros, but the Morphs suddenly become aggressive. It's hard to understand each other if communication is meaningless...

You encounter a Morph ship. However, it's impossible to understand what they are trying to tell you: you only get long lines of 1's and 0's. All that's left for them is to speak the only available language — the language of weapons!

The Morphs you encounter seem to have completely lost their ability to communicate. What's more, they've also begun to charge their weapons! Whatever that means, you've no choice but to defend yourself.

event.text: Terrifying rumors are creeping about in the system in which this beacon is located. The Morphs here have completely lost their sense of compassion and are conducting a monstrous experiment: they are attempting to combine several life forms into one. You could make some profit if you are willing to sacrifice a member of your crew — it's said that living test subjects with unique DNA are always needed here.

choice.text: Attack the probe.

event.text: You decide it's best to destroy this drone.

Leave this dangerous place as soon as possible.

event.text: The analyzer detects metal inside the asteroid, hidden behind a thick stone coating! After quickly drilling through it, you take it all for yourself.

choice.text: Wait until the shuttle approaches.
(Scrap Recovery Arm) Try to catch the shuttle with the arm.
(Repair Arm) Try to catch the shuttle with the arm.
Don't risk it and leave them to the mercy of fate.

event.text: The shuttle crashes into one of the numerous asteroids and explodes. The Morph ship suddenly becomes aggressive. Looks like this time there is no time to talk with the crew.

The shuttle successfully reaches you, and a new crew member comes aboard. Your crew quickly scraps the capsule the new member arrived in.

The arm catches the capsule, but at the same time makes an awkward movement, and the ship receives a powerful blow to one of the supporting structures. The new crew member climbs on board, and the crew quickly scraps the capsule.

We will get a lot of money for these criminals — Yes... we can finally buy some real food." They are attacking you!

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect its wreckage.

deadCrew.text: With the ship captured, you clear out its hold.

choice.text: Inspect the ship and grab everything of value.

event.name: SWORDFISH_R1_OK

Arriving at the distress call, you only find hostile Morphs. Was it a trap?

The Morphs sent the disress signal. When they see you, they Send your message: "10010101, 00111101, 11010110... SYNTAX ERROR... RESTART... Greetings. Thanks for the help. Your ship is required. Reason: Ion storm damage... 11110010... ERROR... RESTART..." They look determined to get your ship!
Arriving at the beacon, you notice a Morph ship. But it doesn't look like they need help — as soon as they see you, they go on the attack!

escape.text: You spot them charging their FTL drive.

deadCrew.text: After capturing the ship, you clean out its hold...

choice.text: Request repairs.
Buy a backup battery.
Buy a battery charger.
Ignore the station and talk to the crew while the FTL drive charges.

choice.text: Decline their services.

event.name: NEBULA_ENGIMENGI_EVENT
event.text: An Engi ship flies before you in the ion storm...

...suddenly a super storm begins! After that, the Engi ship falls into a daze... it looks like they're frozen. You quickly loot useful supplies from their ship before they come to their senses and you get ready to fly away.
...suddenly a super storm begins! A lightning bolt strikes the Engi ship, and they become aggressive. Now they are trying to use your ship to repair theirs!

event.name: DISTRESS_MENGI_BADZOND_EVENT
event.text: The Morphs hail you: "10011011... Greetings. Addressee: UNKNOWN SHIP. Description: 'Broken probe'... ERROR... RESTART... 11110010... Task: 'Destruction'..." It looks like the Morphs need help with their faulty probe.

choice.text: Attack the nearby terraforming probe.

event.text: You decide to help the Morphs and attack the probe.

choice.text: Attack the Morphs themselves.

event.text: The Morphs prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Ignore the Morphs and talk with the crew while the FTL drive charges.

destroyed.text: The probe explodes, and you collect its wreckage...

event.text: You are reapproached by the Morphs who thank you with useful supplies.

event.name: NEBULA_MENGI_DAMAGED_EVENT
event.text: In the nebula, you find a heavily damaged Morph ship. It looks like it's been here for a long time...

choice.text: Take everything valuable from the ship.
Don't get any closer and talk to the crew while the FTL drive charges.

event.text: You grab what trace surviving materials you can find and get ready to fly away.
You grab what trace surviving materials there are out of the ship. Someone aboard your crew finds a clonebay with Morph DNA samples. Unfortunately the clonebay is broken and no longer works.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Use the DNA to reconstruct a clone.
Leave this place.

event.text: Some time later you find a new addition to your crew emerging from the clone bay.
Turns out the DNA samples were more damaged than you thought. It's time to move on.

event.name: NEBULA_MENGI_FIGHT

event.name: NEBULA_PILESOS_EVENT
event.text: When you exit the jump, you observe a grand picture — a Morph ship is rapidly pulling in the remains of a nebula into some kind of device on their hull. It seems that the Morphs must be completely mad, as they are pointing the device at you!

event.name: EVENT_DONT_HACK_MENGI
event.text: It's pretty quiet around this beacon. You carefully study the sector map to plot a further route while the FTL drive charges...
...suddenly a Morph ship comes out of the jump with clearly hostile intentions! Prepare to fight!
...suddenly a Morph ship comes out of the jump with clearly hostile intentions! It looks like they're blocking your hacking with some kind of directional radiation!

destroyed.text: You quickly gather all that survived the explosion.

deadCrew.text: The ship's crew is eliminated. You clear out their holds.

event.name: START_BEACON_ORCHID
event.text: On your way to escape the Rebel fleet, you jump into an Orchid sector. Even though humans have named them after Earth plants, they have little in common with them.

textList.name: STORE_ORCHID
textList.text: This beacon is an Orchid trade hub. Even though most of their equipment is made of plant matter, Orchids find some use for scrap metal as well, and are willing to trade it.
Located at the beacon is a giant Orchid trade station protected by several warships. As you dock and enter the station, you can't help but notice how quiet yet peaceful it is inside.
A lone trading Orchid vessel awaits you at the beacon. Its crew sends you a simple message: "Military goods available for sale."

You stumble upon an Orchid trading station dealing with common goods made from organic materials originating from the Orchid homeworlds. Learning that you represent the Federation, the Orchids agree to sell some military goods as well.

textList.name: NOTHING_ORCHID
textList.text: Orchid space is famous for being calm and peaceful. This beacon exemplifies that.
This beacon serves as a connection. You notice how it is located very far from the local star. Probably as a means of protection against solar flares.
You arrive at a beacon located near a planet in process of terraforming to support plant life. There are no ships around. You prepare to jump away.
This beacon is devoid of any activity at the moment. The star is too dim, providing insufficient energy for light dependent flora.

textList.name: ORCHID_FIND_DRONE
textList.text: Given how fragile Orchids are, they often resort to using drones to deal with emergencies on their ships. A drone factory, still loyal to Federation, is located at the beacon. Orchid engineers offer one of their creations for free.
An Orchid freighter is waiting at the beacon. As soon as you jump in, they message you: "Too much cargo. Can't move. Please take some."

While the FTL drive charges, you decide to explore the surface of a planet nearby. A depowered drone is hidden within the foliage of a giant tree, probably left by pirates. You can find some use for it in your journey.

textList.name: ORCHID_FIND_WEAPON
textList.text: You are surprised to find a secret Federation station deep within Orchid space. Its crew went as far as using traditional Orchid materials like leaves and bark to hide the base. Allies at the station offer a weapon to help on your journey.
An Orchid colony at the nearby moon agrees to give you a weapon in exchange for some rare plant specimen from your home planet you were lucky to have on hand.
As you complete the jump, an Orchid ship explodes nearby for unknown reasons. The only things that survive the explosion are some melted metal parts and a single weapon.

textList.name: ORCHID_FREE_ITEMS
textList.text: A friendly Orchid station at the beacon is offering scrap metal for free. "We don't need it. We prefer titanwood."
The beacon is empty, with no ships or stars around. A single container, resembling a giant seed, is drifting through space. There are some useful scrap and resources within.
The beacon is located far away from systems populated by Orchids. Some remains of destroyed ships are floating around: aftermath of a battle long ago. You harvest what you can.

event.name: ORCHID_FREE_CREW
event.text: You encounter a gigantic Orchid passenger ship with a military escort. One of the passengers contacts you using a makeshift communicator: "Please take me. I can fight. I've stolen a shuttle."

choice.text: Offer them a position on your ship.

event.text: The new addition to your crew turns out to be an Orchid youth. They take a combat pose and excrete chemicals that fill your other crewmembers with determination.

choice.text: Decline.

event.name: ORCHID_DISTRESS_EMPTY_SHIP
event.text: A distress signal is coming from an Orchid ship, drifting far away from common interstellar routes. You try to communicate but there is no answer.

choice.text: Board the ship.
Ignore it.

event.text: You board the ship to find the aftermath of explosion and fire. You can only guess what was the reason of the accident. Most of equipment is burnt, and there is no one alive, but you still manage to find some useful scrap and resources.

The only being alive on the ship is a dehydrated Orchid. The ship ran out of water and life support systems broke down. The entire crew is dead except for one resilient Orchid. Refreshing them back to life with water, they seem eager to be of service.

The boarding team went into the ship to look for survivors. After a while, your crew went into uncontrollable rage. They were returned back to the ship as soon as possible, but one of the crewmembers was affected so strongly that he went mad upon coming back to the ship.

choice.text: (Orchid Crewmember) Let the Orchid calm the madman.

event.text: The Orchid sprays soothing pollen, and the madman gradually comes to their senses. The whole team sighs in relief.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Treat the madman with pheromones.

event.text: As soon as a fresh portion of pheromones enters the crewmember's lungs, they get better.
There is no other way but to kill the poor fellow.
As your ship is under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

event.name: ORCHID_DISTRESS_COLONY_FIRE
event.text: A distress signal is coming from the surface of a planet near the beacon. The wildfire is spreading towards a small Orchid colony which lacks the resources to put fires out, or evacuate in time.

choice.text: Help to evacuate as many Orchids as you can.

event.text: The ecosystem on the Orchid planet is so vulnerable to fire that even your entire crew isn't enough to save the Orchid colony in time. You succeeded in helping the more resilient individuals but most of the Orchid seeds and saplings were lost to the fire.

choice.text: This incident does not concern us.
(Fire Suppression) Use the augment to save the colony.

event.text: The Fire Suppression system is deployed in the colony and helps tremendously in holding back wildfires at key points while the Orchids evacuate. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Use the augment to speed up evacuation.

event.text: Affected by pheromones, your crew and Orchid civilians move a lot faster, leaving no one behind. After the colony is evacuated, one of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Block the wildfire from spreading to win some time.

event.text: Your crewmember erects giant crystalline walls in mere seconds. The flames are slowed down and all of the colony manages to escape to safety. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Lockdown Bomb) Block the wildfire from spreading to win some time.

event.text: The bomb is used to erect giant crystalline walls in mere seconds. The flames are slowed down and all of the colony manages to escape to safety. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

event.name: ORCHID_ZOLTAN_QUEST_START
event.text: An unarmed Zoltan ship greets you. "Our vessel is on a diplomatic mission to Orchid worlds. We would like to hire you to go on ahead of us and offer a small gift to the Orchid council to herald our arrival."

choice.text: Agree to deliver a gift.

event.text: The Zoltans transfer coordinates of their destination and a box containing a gift to Orchids. The package contains a replica of a Zoltan spaceship of unusual shape, radiating light and heat. It's made from high quality metals, resistant to damage, and very pleasant to look at.

choice.text: Decline.

event.name: ORCHID_ZOLTAN_QUEST_FINISH
event.text: You arrive at the coordinates of the Orchid council, and transfer over the symbolic gift of the Zoltans. Even though they are unable to talk themselves, the Orchids perfectly understand any language. They seem satisfied and offer you a reward.

event.name: ORCHID_UNDER_ATTACK_PIRATE
event.text: An unarmed Orchid vessel is trying to flee from a ship with the markings of a space pirate that is chasing behind.

choice.text: Help the Orchid ship.

event.text: You fire a warning shot and the pirate ship changes direction to face you. "That ship is even bigger! Let's loot this one instead." The Orchid vessel stopped far beyond firing distance to watch the battle.

choice.text: Do not intervene.

destroyed.text: The pirate ship breaks apart. You hasten to contact the Orchid ship.

deadCrew.text: No more life signs detected on the pirate ship. You hasten to contact the Orchid ship.

event.text: The Orchid ship had taken heavy damage before you came to help. The only surviving Orchid offers to join your crew.
The Orchid ship offers you some resources as a reward for saving them.
As you fought the pirate, the Orchid ship charged its FTL-drive and jumped away.

event.name: ORCHID_UNARMED_TRADER
event.text: A tiny Orchid trading vessel awaits you at the beacon. Learning that you are from the Federation, they offer some of their supplies to help your cause.

choice.text: Accept their offer.
Extort additional resources: they surely have more.

event.text: The trader sends a distress signal, and an Orchid military ship jumps in immediately to help with weapons online.
The Orchid ship sent a distress signal asking for help... but nobody comes. They have to give up all of their goods to save their lives.

destroyed.text: By the time you dealt with the Orchid military ship, the trading vessel has already escaped the system. You loot the destroyed ship, harvesting some useful scrap material.

deadCrew.text: By the time you dealt with the Orchid military ship, the trading vessel has already escaped the system. You loot the empty ship, harvesting all resources.

event.name: ORCHID_SLAVES
event.text: A rogue ship awaits you at the beacon. "Laborers for cheap! Can be used as oxygen emitters, cannon fodder, gifts to tribal chiefs, firewood, or healthy food."

choice.text: Save the enslaved Orchids!
Buy one Orchid slave.
Decline and jump away.

surrender.text: The slavers surrender. "You can take one of these for free! Use them for whatever purpose you want. Just let us go."

choice.text: Accept their offer.
Surrender is not an option.

destroyed.text: The slave ship is destroyed. They won't continue their evil trade, but many lives were probably lost on that ship.

deadCrew.text: With all of the overlords dead, one of enslaved Orchids accepts an offer to join your crew.

event.name: ORCHID_BOTANICAL_GALLERY
event.text: A giant Orchid station is located at the beacon. It's marked as an "Augmented Botanical Gallery" on your star map.

choice.text: Visit the station.

event.text: An atmosphere of tranquility with a small touch of curiosity fills the main hall. There are all kinds of strange exhibits in the gallery. You wonder which to visit.

choice.text: Pay an entry fee to visit "May's Burst".

event.text: The exhibit contains a giant sphere, protected from all sides with reinforced metal coating. Giant trees are growing inside. You feel a bit disappointed...

Suddenly, a series of explosions shakes the entire station. The trees' fruits are bursting, releasing giant kernels in all directions. The protective sphere can barely stop the kernels from destroying the station. An Orchid employee offers a weapon created for firing kernels for free.

choice.text: Pay an entry fee to visit "Ham Pie".

event.text: The exhibit contains a field of... grass. It looks like usual Earth grass with plain flowers but a strangely familiar leaf pattern. Was it really worth it?

After a few minutes on the meadow you feel your worries go away, a desire to laugh, and an irresistible urge to hug a Mantis nearby. After a while, you and the Mantis who turned out to be another visitor become best friends and they agree to join your crew.

choice.text: Pay an entry fee to visit "Quick Sap".

event.text: This exhibit is an unusual machine made entirely of plant matter. The contraption pumps out sap from slender white-barked trees and moves it to the processing area, which outputs a liquid, advertised as high quality FTL fuel.
Since you have already paid for entry, the Orchids are offering some of their experimental fuel for free.

choice.text: Leave the gallery without visiting anything.
Charge the FTL drive.

event.name: ORCHID_SLUG_TAUNT
event.text: You are surprised to find a Slug ship in a system mostly populated by Orchids. The Slugs are requesting to communicate using an encrypted channel.

choice.text: Agree to talk with the Slugs.

event.text: "Greetingss, two-legged meatsssack. We have been looking for sssuch a fine ssspecimen for a century. You are truly the ugliessst human in the galaxy and deserve to be embalmed and shown in a museum. I only wonder what your mom looksss like."

choice.text: Open fire!

event.text: You fire at the Slug ship and they immediately respond with evasive maneuvers. The Slug captain sends a distress message to a nearby Orchid planet claiming to be attacked by pirates. To your surprise, the Orchids respond by locking an Anti-Ship Battery onto your ship. It was all a part of the Slugs' plan...

choice.text: Close communications and leave the beacon.
Decline and talk to the crew while the FTL drive charges.

textList.name: ORCHID_FIGHT
textList.text: A hostile Orchid ship awaits you at the beacon. Without a single word, they open fire.

The Orchids at the beacon behave unusually aggressive. One of the ships moves in your direction with weapons online. Scans indicate that the crew is being consumed by some form of alien plant parasites.
An Orchid military ship approaches and scans your ship. Having found that you're far from being peaceful, the Orchids arm their weapons to protect their home.
An unusually verbose Orchid ship at the beacon messages you: "We got reports that you aliens are feeding upon sentient flora after cooking them with fire! For that crime you shall be punished!"
An Orchid ship awaits you at the beacon. An ominous message appears on communication screen: "In this world... It's KILL or BE killed!"

choice.text: Accept their offer.
We will not accept surrender!

textList.name: ORCHID_SURRENDER
textList.text: The Orchid ship turns all weapons offline hoping that you will do the same.
The Orchid ship is nearly destroyed. Its crew is sending you pictures symbolizing peace, and valuable cargo, probably asking to surrender.
The Orchids on screen frantically wave their leaves and hastily peck away at the keyboard. You then receive a message full of typos: "we surender, pleeze cese fier!"

textList.name: ORCHID_PIRATE_FIGHT
textList.text: The Orchids put a lot of effort into maintaining security of their homeworlds, but a pirate still managed to slip through their defenses. Prepare for battle!
The Orchid sectors are considered relatively safe and attract traders and refugees. Those, in turn, attract pirates.
A ship with pirate markings awaits you at the beacon. You overhear a conversation on their ship: "Those aren't space weeds." "Whatever. Kill them anyway."
You were enjoying the view of an overgrown Orchid jungle planet when a pirate jumps in out of nowhere. Conflict is inevitable.

textList.name: ORCHID_ROCK_FIGHT
textList.text: Rock ships are often seen in Orchid sectors. Contrary to their xenophobic nature, Rocks are quite fond of Orchids. This particular ship is acting hostile towards you, though.

Rocks are often seen as useful by Orchids for their ability to withstand fire and how easy they are to manipulate. A Rock ship at the beacon sees you as a threat to their floral overlords and attacks!

Orchid sectors are a common destination for wealthier Rock travelers. Having a body overgrown with rare plants is considered fashionable in Rock culture. A Rock ship at the beacon considers you threatening and retaliates.

textList.name: ORCHID_MANTIS_FIGHT
textList.text: The warlike Mantis send their ships all over the galaxy to hunt other ships for loot and glory. Orchid sectors are no exception.

The Orchids put tremendous effort into pacifying invading Mantis and forming friendly relations with them. But some Mantis will never leave the path of a warrior. The ship at the beacon belongs to those.
Some Mantis are influenced by Orchids so much that they begin to worship all kinds of plants and do the only thing they think would please their gods: kill everyone who doesn't belong.

textList.name: ORCHID_REBEL_FIGHT
textList.text: A Rebel fighter awaits you at the beacon. An image of a human officer appears on the comm screen: "We have come to weed-out this sector from aliens and Federation sympathizers. Starting with you!"
An aggressive Rebel ship has chosen a beacon far away from primary Orchid worlds to wait for your potential arrival. As soon as it sees you, it moves closer with weapons armed.
This beacon was marked as populated by friendly Orchids on the sector map but the Rebel fleet has already began to invade it. One of the smaller Rebel ships attacks.

textList.name: ORCHID_AUTO_FIGHT
textList.text: Learning that many Federation ships are using Orchid homeworlds as a hiding place, the Rebels sent many automated ships to hunt those who oppose the Rebellion. One of those crewless ships is waiting for you at the beacon.
An automated ship is broadcasting a message: "Plant life outlawed. Only humans allowed in the sector. Glory to Rebellion." It's openly hostile to everyone except Rebels.
The remains of an Orchid civilian ship are drifting at the beacon. The culprit, an automated Rebel ship, turns around and moves towards you with weapons warming-up.

textList.name: ORCHID_CAPTURED_REBEL_FIGHT
textList.text: You are surprised to hear the crew of an Orchid ship talk in human language: "Surrender. All nearby worlds are controlled by Rebellion forces. Resistance is futile."
An Orchid ship behaves unusually aggressively. Scans show that it is captured by humans wearing Rebel uniform.
The Orchid ship located at the beacon moves back and forth. The Rebels who captured it haven't learned how to pilot it yet, but are already attacking you.

event.name: ORCHID_PIRATE_FRIENDLY_ASB
event.text: A pirate ship worn out by many battles moves in your direction from behind an Orchid planet. Maybe it's time to check how well the Orchids are keeping their systems safe?

choice.text: Engage the pirate alone.
Ask for help.

event.text: You send a distress signal, and Orchid military stationed at the planet respond immediately and target the pirate with anti-ship battery.

event.name: ORCHID_BOSS_EVENT
event.text: A massive Orchid mother ship patrols the area. As soon as you appear, it turns in your direction, clearly charging their unusual kernel launcher prototype.

destroyed.text: The mother ship breaks apart, and you collect its wreckage...

deadCrew.text: With the mother ship captured, you take everything of value...

event.text: Fortunately their prototype was not damaged in the battle, and you transfer it to your ship.
Their prototype was damaged in the battle but still works. You transfer it to your ship.
